{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","title":"How to Erase Google History","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Whenever you use Google on a web browser or an app, it automatically saves what you searched, where you are, and what websites you’re visiting. Your Google <i>history</i> is a list of all the websites and searches you’ve visited, while your Google <i>activity</i> is what Google saves behind the scenes, like your location. You can erase both of them by using your computer or your mobile device, and you can even adjust your settings to automatically delete your activity for you. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Erase-Google-History&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Erase-Google-History&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Clearing Your Google Activity on a Computer\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Clearing-Your-Google-Activity-on-a-Computer\">Clearing Your Google Activity on a Computer</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Go to <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://myaccount.google.com\">https://myaccount.google.com</a>. This is your Google account page, which is where you'll find all of your privacy, security, and personalization options.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Erase-Google-History-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"547\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're not already signed in to your Google account, follow the on-screen instructions to sign in now.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click . It’s on the top left hand side of the screen.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-2-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 2 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Erase-Google-History-Step-2-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-2-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . It’s under the “Activity and Timeline” header.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-3-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 3 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Erase-Google-History-Step-3-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-3-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"545\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click the “More” button. It’s at the top right hand corner of the screen. On your computer, it looks like 3 dots stacked on top of each other.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-4-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 4 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Erase-Google-History-Step-4-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-4-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Select . This will take you to a new page.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-5-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 5 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/86/Erase-Google-History-Step-5-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-5-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click , then . This will clear your Google activity, including your web and app activity, your YouTube activity, and your location history.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-6-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 6 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Erase-Google-History-Step-6-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-6-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also manually select what activity to delete by clicking the boxes one by one.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Erase-Google-History&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Clearing Your Google History on a Computer\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Clearing-Your-Google-History-on-a-Computer\">Clearing Your Google History on a Computer</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Go to <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://myaccount.google.com\">https://myaccount.google.com</a>. This is your Google account page, which is where you'll find all of your privacy, security, and personalization options.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Erase-Google-History-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"547\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're not already signed in to your Google account, follow the on-screen instructions to sign in now.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click . It’s on the upper right hand side, and it looks like 3 dots stacked on top of each other. This will open a dropdown menu with a few different options.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-8-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 8 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Erase-Google-History-Step-8-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-8-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Select , then click on again. From the dropdown menu, click on the “History” option to open up a second dropdown menu. At the top of the new dropdown menu, select again.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-9-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 9 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Erase-Google-History-Step-9-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-9-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also press + H.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click . It’s on the left side of the screen. When you click this, a box will show up on your screen.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-10-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 10 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Erase-Google-History-Step-10-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-10-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Select to clear all of your history. Or, you can go through your history and manually select what you’d like to delete by checking the boxes one by one.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-11-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 11 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a1/Erase-Google-History-Step-11-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-11-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . This will erase your search history from your browser.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-12-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 12 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fb/Erase-Google-History-Step-12-Version-5.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-12-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Erase-Google-History&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Automatically Clearing Your Google History\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Automatically-Clearing-Your-Google-History\">Automatically Clearing Your Google History</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Go to <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://myaccount.google.com\">https://myaccount.google.com</a> in a web browser. Although Google logs your searches and other activities automatically, you can set up your account so this info is deleted after a certain period of time.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-13-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 13 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/66/Erase-Google-History-Step-13-Version-4.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-13-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"547\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Google gives you a little bit of power when it comes to what data and information they save about you, like your location history, your web and app activity, and your YouTube history.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click . It's in the left menu. If you're using a phone or tablet, you may have to tap the menu icon at the top-left corner to find it.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-14-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 14 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Erase-Google-History-Step-14-Version-4.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-14-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"543\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . It's the blue link at the bottom of the \"Activity controls\" section.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-15-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 15 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Erase-Google-History-Step-15-Version-4.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-15-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"543\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Review the type of activity tracked by Google. You'll find 3 sections in your activity controls:<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-16-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 16 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Erase-Google-History-Step-16-Version-4.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-16-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"545\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li><b>Web &amp; App Activity:</b> This is where Google saves your searches (everywhere from the Google search engine to Google Maps and Google Play), IP addresses, ads you click, voice recordings, and the things you do on your Android.</li> \n    <li><b>Location History:</b> This is where you'll find a log of where you've been, as well as recommendations based on places you've visited.</li> \n    <li><b>YouTube History:</b> Google/YouTube keeps track of videos you've watched and what you've searched for.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Turn off automatic history/activity logging (optional). If you don't want Google to save your history from any of these categories, slide its corresponding switch to the Off (gray) position, review the warning message, and then click <b>Pause</b>.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Erase-Google-History-Step-17.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"543\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This does not delete any of your past data, so you’ll have to do that manually.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Set up automatic deletion (optional). If you are okay with Google logging your history but want to make sure it's automatically deleted after a certain period of time:<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-18.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 18.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Erase-Google-History-Step-18.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-18.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"544\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Click <b>Auto-delete (Off)</b> next to any of the three categories.</li> \n    <li>Select a time period and tap <b>Next</b>.</li> \n    <li>Review the data that will be deleted if you choose to continue.</li> \n    <li>Click <b>Confirm</b>.</li> \n    <li>Repeat for any other category you want to set up for automatic deletion.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Erase-Google-History&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Clearing Google History on Your iPhone\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Clearing-Google-History-on-Your-iPhone\">Clearing Google History on Your iPhone</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Open the Google Chrome app. It’s a rainbow-colored circle on a white background.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don’t have the Chrome app, you can find it on the App Store.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tap , then . The “More” button is in the top right hand side of the screen, and it looks like 3 dots in a horizontal line. Open this menu, then select .<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-20-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 20 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Erase-Google-History-Step-20-Version-2.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-20-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Now you can take a look at your browser history on the app.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tap . It’s near the bottom of the screen.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-21-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 21 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Erase-Google-History-Step-21-Version-2.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-21-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Check . It might be checked by default. If there are any items you don’t want to delete, uncheck them before moving on.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-22-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 22 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Erase-Google-History-Step-22-Version-2.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-22-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap again. This will clear everything you have checked.<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 23 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9b/Erase-Google-History-Step-23-Version-2.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . It’s in the top right corner of the screen. This will take you back to the homepage of Google Chrome.<sup id=\"_ref-24\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Erase-Google-History#_note-24\">[24]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Erase-Google-History-Step-24-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Erase Google History Step 24 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Erase-Google-History-Step-24-Version-2.jpg/aid2850736-v4-728px-Erase-Google-History-Step-24-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Erase-Google-History&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Google uses your history to make relevant recommendations in its apps, in search results, and on the web. If disabling your history or activity causes problems, just re-enable it by returning to <b>Manage your activity controls</b> and tapping the switch.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Erase-Google-History&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" "createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","title":"How to Fix a Crack in a Water Bottle","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Cracked water bottles are a huge pain and can leave you with plenty of unexpected messes to clean up. The best thing to do is simply buy a new one, but if you find yourself in a bind, there are a couple of options. If you’re looking for a more long-term solution, apply some silicone sealant to the problem spot. If you’re on the market for a quick fix, use waterproof tape instead. Avoid using superglue, since it's not food-safe and isn't likely to work all that well. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Using Food-Grade Silicone Sealant\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-Food-Grade-Silicone-Sealant\">Using Food-Grade Silicone Sealant</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Apply a line of food-grade silicone sealant on top of the crack. Search online for a bottle of silicone sealant, which works like a waterproof glue. Before making any purchases, double-check that the sealant is food-grade since you’ll be drinking out of the repaired water bottle.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Squeeze out a consistent line of sealant along the crack, as though you’re gluing both ends of the fissure together.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix a Crack in a Water Bottle Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Spread the sealant along the entire crack.</li> \n    <li>Silicone sealant bottles come pretty small. Depending on the brand, you can get one for less than $10.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wait for the sealant to cure completely. Read the sealant label to see how much time the product needs to dry, or cure, completely. Don’t pour any water into the bottle until that amount of time has passed.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix a Crack in a Water Bottle Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1a/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You may need to wait several hours before you can use your water bottle again.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Test out your water bottle and see if it leaks. Fill your water bottle up and tighten the lid. As you did before, flip and shake your bottle around and see if you’ve successfully repaired it. Hopefully, your water bottle will be fixed and ready to go!\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix a Crack in a Water Bottle Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Taping as a Temporary Fix\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Taping-as-a-Temporary-Fix\">Taping as a Temporary Fix</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Find exactly where the crack is located. Look along the sides or bottom of your bottle for any obvious cracks or fissures. If you can’t find the crack right away, shake the bottle around to see where the source of the leak is.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix a Crack in a Water Bottle Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Apply a strip of waterproof tape over the crack. Grab a roll of waterproof tape and rip off a strip that’s large enough to cover the fissure. Center the tape over the crack in the same way you’d cover a scrape with a bandage. Press along the edges of the tape to ensure that it’s in place.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix a Crack in a Water Bottle Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Alternatively, use plumber’s tape instead.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Check your bottle to see if it’s still leaking. Fill your water bottle up with water, then shake it around to see if there are any leaks. If water is still leaking out, you may need to use a bigger strip of tape.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix a Crack in a Water Bottle Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If your water bottle is severely cracked, then repairs might be more trouble than they’re worth. You can find a cheap replacement online, or in any store that sells water bottles and sporting equipment.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Using Food-Grade Silicone Sealant\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-Food-Grade-Silicone-Sealant_2\">Using Food-Grade Silicone Sealant</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Food-grade silicone sealant</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Taping as a Temporary Fix\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Taping-as-a-Temporary-Fix_2\">Taping as a Temporary Fix</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Waterproof tape</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://news.thomasnet.com/fullstory/food-grade-silicone-sealant-comes-in-standard-custom-colors-609101\">https://news.thomasnet.com/fullstory/food-grade-silicone-sealant-comes-in-standard-custom-colors-609101</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=PlPe-ovKceQ&amp;t=0m2s\">https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=PlPe-ovKceQ&amp;t=0m2s</a></span> </li> \n   <li \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 03 Dec 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"61fe10570977611917dcb0ece404b6cf","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn49@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-00-31-861_afd9ce479dc16471.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":65603,"destBytes":38410,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn49@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-00-31-861_afd9ce479dc16471.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1a/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn7@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-01-02-251_79fe8b6b44815279.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn20@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-01-09-127_7fe965a782d4d360.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn23@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-01-03-714_66e0cf4e8aa9d7ca.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12040324-v4-728px-Fix-a-Crack-in-a-Water-Bottle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn29@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-01-07-086_bfccda7ad959c32a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607673631403},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","title":"How to Make Someone Smile","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Getting someone to smile is always a rewarding and positive experience that not only makes them feel better but will probably make you feel better as well! By telling someone a joke, complimenting them, sending them a handwritten letter, or giving them a gift, there’s a good chance you can get them to smile. If all else fails, you can always bring out your greatest weapon: your own smile. There’s nothing like being smiled at to make a person smile in return! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Telling Them Jokes\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Telling-Them-Jokes\">Telling Them Jokes</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Know your audience. If you want someone to really appreciate a joke, and smile at it, you need to tell a joke you know will appeal to their particular sense of humor. You can’t tell a joke that you know they’ll find offensive or dull and expect them to appreciate it. Try to play to their interests and sensibilities to get them to laugh.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8a/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if your friend is a big fan of puns, you could tell them a joke with a pun as the punchline, like “Did you hear about the restaurant on the moon? Great food, no atmosphere.” <sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If your friend likes knock-knock jokes, you could tell them this one: “Knock, knock. Who's there? Amish! Amish who? You're not a shoe!”<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Follow the rule of 3. The rule of 3 is a classic joke-telling pattern in which the punchline is delivered in the third line of the joke. The first 2 lines set up the pattern of the joke, while the third line breaks the pattern.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-2-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 2 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-2-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example: “I go to Las Vegas to see the shows, eat at the buffets, and visit my money.” Here, 2 expected things set the pattern and then are followed by something unexpected.</li> \n    <li>Another example would be “A man goes into a psychiatrist, and says, ‘Doctor, my brother thinks he’s a chicken.’ The doctor says, ‘Why don’t you take him to the hospital?’ The man says, ‘I would, but we need the eggs.’”<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Practice your rhythm and timing. Rhythm and timing are essential to good joke-telling. The rhythm dictates the structure of a joke (the order in which each part of a joke is delivered from setup to punchline), while timing relates to a joke-teller’s ability to judge when each part of the joke should be delivered given the responses of the audience.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-3-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 3 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-3-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Practice telling your joke over and over to get a sense of your command of the best rhythm and timing. You can practice in a mirror, record yourself with your phone, or tell your joke to another person.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tell your joke at the right time. Wait for the right moment. If the person you want to tell your joke to is distracted by something else or is in a particularly bad mood, they may not be receptive to your joke or want to pay attention to it. Wait until you have the full attention and focus before you tell your joke to them.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 4 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some bad moods may be more receptive to jokes than others. If someone is angry or has just experienced a major loss, they probably won’t want to hear a joke. If they’re just having a bad day or are momentarily upset about something, a joke might be able to cheer them up.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Giving Them Compliments\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Giving-Them-Compliments\">Giving Them Compliments</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Be specific about why you’re complimenting them. The most memorable compliments are ones that include specific examples explaining why the compliment is worth giving. For example, don’t just say that someone is kind; give an example of a time when that person was kind.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to use examples that are recent. It may seem odd if you compliment someone for something they did several months earlier.</li> \n    <li>For example, you could say “I thought it was really nice of you to plan our friend’s birthday party the other day.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Give honest compliments, not fake ones. People can tell if you’re not giving a real compliment. So, don’t tell them that they’re kind if they’re not really that kind. Instead, find something about them that is genuinely worthy of a compliment. Everyone has something for which you can compliment them.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you could say “I think you’re the smartest person on our trivia team. You always know the answers to the tough science and math questions.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Acknowledge how their character made the compliment worth giving. The best compliments are ones that reflect positively on a person not just in the moment, but on a fundamental level. Think about how their character or personality influenced the act that made them worthy of a compliment and how that makes them unique.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you compliment someone for a specific act of kindness, for example, you could tell them that you think they are a kind person in general with a unique generosity of spirit.</li> \n    <li>For instance, you could say “It was really nice of you to help that person change their tire. Not many people would do that, and I think it just shows how generous and giving you are.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tell them how much you appreciate what they did to deserve the compliment. Showing your appreciation for what someone has done always makes your compliment more memorable and makes them appreciate it even more. Plus it will help to strengthen your relationship with that person.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could tell them how much you appreciate having such a kind friend because it makes you want to be more kind.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>You could also say “Seeing you volunteer at the recycling center made me realize how important the environment is, and now I want to volunteer there too.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Sending Them a Handwritten Letter\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sending-Them-a-Handwritten-Letter\">Sending Them a Handwritten Letter</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Use a fountain pen and good quality stationery. A letter worth smiling over isn’t just going to be written on college ruled paper with a number 2 pencil. Find a good fountain pen and some good stationery online so that your letter is worth keeping.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you can’t get your hands on stationery, you could also use a blank greeting card.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Write the letter in a conversational tone. Your materials should be fancy, but your content shouldn’t. Writing your letter like an 18th-century English baron will probably be borderline incomprehensible to your recipient.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Handwritten letters don’t need to be just for someone living far away. It could also be for someone you see frequently.</li> \n    <li>For someone living far away, you could write about what’s happening in your life, tell your recipient how much you miss them, reminisce over shared memories, and ask them what’s new in their life.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>For someone you see frequently, you could write about how much you enjoy spending time with them, your thoughts on activities you’ve recently done together, and future activities you can plan with them.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Seal the letter with a wax impression. There are several options when using a wax impression for letters. You can purchase pre-made seals online with adhesive backs if you don’t want to do too much work, or you can buy wax and impressions for making seals on your own.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you make your own wax seals, you can buy wax and the impression of your choosing online or at a craft store.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>To make the seal, use a butane lighter to melt the wax so that it drips onto your envelope to seal the bottom of the “V” on the back flap, then press the impression into the wax. You can also find wax sticks for use with a glue gun at craft stores and online.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Mail the letter. Write the recipient’s address in the center on the front of the envelope, and your own address in the top right on the front of the envelope. Then, visit your local post office during its operating hours and ask if your letter will require any special postage for mailing. Pay the postage and then give your letter to a post office employee to be mailed.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Because stationery and wax seals add to the weight, you will most likely need to pay a little extra for your postage.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Giving Them Gifts\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Giving-Them-Gifts\">Giving Them Gifts</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Give something you know the recipient will appreciate. Don’t just give money. Give something that appeals to your recipient’s interests and sensibilities. Focus on giving experiences rather than material goods, especially experiences that you can share together.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 13 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The gift doesn’t have to be expensive, and something that costs a lot might seem like overkill anyway. Spending a few dollars on a short activity could be just as well-received as something more elaborate.</li> \n    <li>For example, you could give them tickets to a concert by a musician that you both enjoy so that you can spend time together.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Giving shared experiences will not only strengthen your relationship, it will show them that you appreciate their company and want to spend more time with them.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wrap the gift. When you give a gift, it should always be wrapped. You can easily find wrapping paper online. Choose a wrapping paper that you know they will appreciate. If they like Star Wars, for example, you could wrap their gift in Star Wars wrapping paper.<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 14 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Even experiences can be wrapped. If you give someone concert tickets, for example, you can put the tickets in a small box and wrap the box.<sup id=\"_ref-24\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-24\">[24]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Include a thoughtful message with the gift. Don’t just give the person their gift, include a card with a thoughtful message in it. Use the message to tell them how much you appreciate them and why you think they deserve the gift.<sup id=\"_ref-25\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 25\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-25\">[25]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-15-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 15 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-15-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-15-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you could write “Since you planned our friend’s birthday party, I thought you deserved your own gift. So, I bought us concert tickets so we could spend some time together!”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Figure out the best time to give the gift. Don’t give them the gift when they’re busy or preoccupied or they won’t fully appreciate it. Choose a time when you have their full attention. You can also consider giving them the gift when they seem sad because it might cheer them up.<sup id=\"_ref-26\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 26\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-26\">[26]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-16-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 16 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-16-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-16-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Smiling at Them\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Smiling-at-Them\">Smiling at Them</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pick the right time to smile. Numerous studies have shown that smiling produces a positive reaction in other people and often gets them to smile back.<sup id=\"_ref-27\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 27\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-27\">[27]</a></sup> But, if you smile at someone at the wrong time, its impact is lost. Make sure the person you’re smiling at is giving you their full attention and is in a receptive mood for a smile.<sup id=\"_ref-28\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 28\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-28\">[28]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-17-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 17 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-17-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-17-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, it might not be a good idea to smile at someone while they’re mourning another person’s loss at a funeral, or while they’re trying to find their keys.<sup id=\"_ref-29\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 29\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-29\">[29]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>On the other hand, it might be a better time to smile at someone if you’re having a conversation with them, comforting them after a bad day, or telling them a joke.</li> \n    <li>Smiling at someone might make them smile even if you don’t know each other.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Smile with your whole face, not just your mouth. People can tell if you’re giving them a fake smile, so make sure your smile is genuine. Don’t just smile with your mouth or show your teeth, crinkle up your whole face and especially your eyes. That way they know you’re giving them a smile with your whole attention.<sup id=\"_ref-30\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 30\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-30\">[30]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-18-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 18 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-18-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-18-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try practicing your smile in the mirror while you think of pleasant thoughts. That will give you a gauge of what your most genuine smile looks like.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Look them in the eyes. Eye contact is the surest way to show someone that they have your full attention, and the best smiles are given when you’re focusing entirely on the person at whom you’re smiling.<sup id=\"_ref-31\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 31\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-31\">[31]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-Step-19-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile Step 19 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Make-Someone-Smile-Step-19-Version-3.jpg/aid1778315-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-Step-19-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Eye contact will also make your interaction more memorable for the other person, so the impact of your smile will last longer.<sup id=\"_ref-32\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 32\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_note-32\">[32]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Sample Ways to Make People Smile\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sample-Ways-to-Make-People-Smile\">Sample Ways to Make People Smile</span></h3> \n <div id=\"sd_container\">\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <div class=\"sd_content\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/Compliments-to-Make-Someone-Smile\" class=\"sd_link\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"481\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Compliments-to-Make-Someone-Smile_sample.png/340px-Compliments-to-Make-Someone-Smile_sample.png\" id=\"5fd31ffaf258a\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5fd31ffaf258a')</script>\n     <noscript>\n      <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Compliments-to-Make-Someone-Smile_sample.png/340px-Compliments-to-Make-Someone-Smile_sample.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"481\" />\n     </noscript><span>Compliments to Make Someone Smile</span></a>\n   </div>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <div class=\"sd_content\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/Random-Acts-of-Kindness-Ideas\" class=\"sd_link\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"481\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Random-Acts-of-Kindness-Ideas_sample.png/340px-Random-Acts-of-Kindness-Ideas_sample.png\" id=\"5fd31ffaf3044\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5fd31ffaf3044')</script>\n     <noscript>\n      <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Random-Acts-of-Kindness-Ideas_sample.png/340px-Random-Acts-of-Kindness-Ideas_sample.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"481\" />\n     </noscript><span>Random Acts of Kindness Ideas</span></a>\n   </div>\n  </div>\n </div> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/good-news/seven-seas/how-to-tell-a-joke/\">https://www.telegraph.co.uk/good-news/seven-seas/how-to-tell-a-joke/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://pun.me/pages/dad-jokes.php\">http://pun.me/pages/dad-jokes.php</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://hermes.webster.edu/mercukat/RuleofThree.html\">http://hermes.webster.edu/mercukat/RuleofThree.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-5\"><a target=\"_blank\"
