\n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 06 Dec 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Apologize-For-Cheating-on-Your-Partner-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Apologize-For-Cheating-on-Your-Partner-Step-16-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"d33912b9406ad413a4b845ed99529fee","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn17@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-00-37-626_d06866b7346ee470.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":43631,"destBytes":25578,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Apologize-For-Cheating-on-Your-Partner-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Apologize-For-Cheating-on-Your-Partner-Step-16-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn17@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-00-37-626_d06866b7346ee470.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-2-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn82@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-00-56-066_3264ed8a5dfe01ad.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-3-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn72@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-01-04-358_22a1845182132b0e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-4-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn62@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-01-02-923_1ef38cf0ec912923.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-5-Version-5.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-5-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn41@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-01-08-877_070d50175d902d9d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-6-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn99@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-01-04-748_b1819fc0a3e37170.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-7-Version-4.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-7-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn86@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-00-54-919_5839a2815efc6868.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn95@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-01-09-934_9dac97d20e6dd9fa.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid386933-v4-728px-Block-Mobile-Phone-Spam-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn28@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-01-09-089_ded9f8e690e0567c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607673631417},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","title":"How to Make Coconut Bread","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Take a tropical break the next time you have tea or breakfast. Make an easy coconut bread that's great for toasting or eating plain. It's full of flaked coconut and has a hint of cinnamon, but not a lot of sugar so it's a great choice for a snack. If you're looking for coconut bread that's moist and cake-like, make a tender coconut bread that has shredded coconut and coconut extract. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Ingredients\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Ingredients\">Ingredients</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Simple Coconut Quick Bread\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Simple-Coconut-Quick-Bread\">Simple Coconut Quick Bread</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>2 eggs</li> \n  <li>of milk</li> \n  <li>of vanilla</li> \n  <li>2 1/2 cups (315 g) of all-purpose flour</li> \n  <li>1/4 teaspoon (1 g) of salt</li> \n  <li>2 teaspoons (10 g) of baking powder</li> \n  <li>2 teaspoons (4 g) of cinnamon</li> \n  <li>1 cup (200 g) of white sugar</li> \n  <li>1 1/2 cups (140 g) of flaked coconut</li> \n  <li>6 tablespoons (84 g) of melted butter</li>\n </ul> \n <p><i>Makes 1 loaf</i> </p> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Gluten-Free Coconut Bread\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Gluten-Free-Coconut-Bread\">Gluten-Free Coconut Bread</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>1 cup (93 g) of unsweetened shredded coconut, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Toast-Coconut\" title=\"Toast Coconut\">toasted</a></li> \n  <li>1 1/2 cups (240 g) of white rice flour</li> \n  <li>3/4 cup (90 g) of sorghum flour</li> \n  <li>3/4 cup (90 g) of tapioca starch</li> \n  <li>1 1/2 teaspoons (7.5 g) of baking powder</li> \n  <li>1 1/2 teaspoons (7.5 g) of baking soda</li> \n  <li>3/4 teaspoon (3.5 g) of kosher salt</li> \n  <li>1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of xanthan gum</li> \n  <li>1 1/2 cups (300 g) of sugar</li> \n  <li>of unsweetened coconut milk</li> \n  <li>of vegetable oil</li> \n  <li>of coconut extract</li> \n  <li>4 large eggs</li> \n  <li>1/4 cup (23 g) of unsweetened coconut flakes</li>\n </ul> \n <p><i>Makes 1 loaf</i> </p> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Moist Coconut Bread with Sweet Glaze\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Moist-Coconut-Bread-with-Sweet-Glaze\">Moist Coconut Bread with Sweet Glaze</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>3 cups (360 g) of all-purpose flour</li> \n  <li>2 teaspoons (10 g) of baking powder</li> \n  <li>1⁄2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of baking soda</li> \n  <li>1 teaspoon (5 g) of salt</li> \n  <li>2 cups (400 g) of sugar</li> \n  <li>of vegetable oil</li> \n  <li>4 eggs, lightly beaten</li> \n  <li>of coconut extract</li> \n  <li>of buttermilk</li> \n  <li>1 cup (92 g) of shredded coconut</li>\n </ul> \n <p><i>Makes 2 loaves</i> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Simple Coconut Quick Bread\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Simple-Coconut-Quick-Bread_2\">Simple Coconut Quick Bread</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Preheat the oven to and grease a loaf pan. Get out an loaf pan and spray the inside with nonstick spray. If you don't have spray, lightly spread butter or shortening inside the pan and coat it with flour. Then, tap out the excess flour and set the pan aside.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you'd rather make the bread into muffins, grease a 12-cup muffin tin.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Mix 2 eggs with milk and vanilla in a mixing bowl. Crack the eggs into a small bowl and pour in of milk and of vanilla. Whisk the wet ingredients until the egg yolks are incorporated.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For an extra coconut flavor, substitute the same amount of coconut milk for the milk.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Whisk the flour, salt, baking powder, and cinnamon in a separate bowl. Get out another mixing bowl and put 2 1/2 cups (315 g) of flour into it. Add 1/4 teaspoon (1 g) of salt, 2 teaspoons (10 g) of baking powder, and 2 teaspoons (4 g) of cinnamon. Then, whisk for about 10 seconds to combine the dry ingredients.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you like a heavily spiced bread, add 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground nutmeg.</li> \n    <li>To let more of the coconut flavor shine, reduce the cinnamon to 1 teaspoon (2 g).</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Stir sugar and flaked coconut into the dry mixture. Pour 1 cup (200 g) of white sugar into the large mixing bowl and add 1 1/2 cups (140 g) of flaked coconut. Stir until the sugar and coconut are combined.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don't have flaked coconut, it's fine to substitute the same amount of shredded coconut.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir in melted butter. Use the back of a spoon to make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. Pour in the wet mixture and stir the batter just until the dry ingredients absorb the wet mixture. Then, stir in 6 tablespoons (84 g) of melted butter and stop mixing when the batter is smooth.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try not to overmix the coconut bread batter or your bread will be tough.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Spread the batter in the greased loaf pan. Use a rubber spatula to spoon the batter into your prepared loaf pan. Then, use the back of the spoon or an offset spatula to smooth the top of the batter so it's level.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're filling a muffin tin, divide the batter evenly between the 12 cavities.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Bake the coconut bread for 1 to 1 1/4 hours. Put the pan in the oven and bake the coconut bread until the edges pull away from the sides of the pan. To test if the bread is done, stick a toothpick or cake tester into the center of the bread. The tester will come out clean if the bread is done.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If there's still batter sticking to the toothpick or cake tester, bake the bread for another 5 minutes and check it again.</li> \n    <li>If you're baking muffins, start checking them after 20 minutes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cool the coconut bread in the pan for 5 minutes. Once the bread is done, wear oven mitts to take it out of the oven. Set the pan on the stove but don't take the bread out of it. Leave the bread to cool for 5 minutes so it's easier to handle and holds its shape.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Turn the bread onto a wire rack to finish cooling. Set a wire rack on the counter and carefully flip the bread out of the pan onto the rack. Although you can cut the bread while it's still warm, you'll get neater slices if you wait until the bread is completely cooled before you cut it. Serve the coconut bread with butter or dust it with powdered sugar for an extra treat.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Store the cooled bread in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Gluten-Free Coconut Bread\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Gluten-Free-Coconut-Bread_2\">Gluten-Free Coconut Bread</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Preheat the oven to and line a loaf pan with parchment paper. Get out an loaf pan and cut a piece of parchment paper so it's large enough to cover the bottom and long sides of the pan. Push the paper into the loaf pan and set it aside.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don't have parchment paper, you can spray the inside of the pan with nonstick baking spray.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Whisk the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl. Get out a medium-sized mixing bowl and pour in 1 1/2 cups (240 g) of white rice flour, 3/4 cup (90 g) of sorghum flour, and 3/4 cup (90 g) of tapioca starch. Then, whisk in 1 1/2 teaspoons (7.5 g) of baking powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons (7.5 g) of baking soda, 3/4 teaspoon (3.5 g) of kosher salt, and 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of xanthan gum.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Xanthan gum is a food additive that acts as a gluten-substitute so your bread rises better. If you can't find it, feel free to skip it since your bread also has baking powder to rise.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Beat sugar with coconut milk, oil, and coconut extract in a separate bowl. Put 1 1/2 cups (300 g) of sugar into a large mixing bowl and add of unsweetened coconut milk along with of vegetable oil and of coconut extract. Then, beat the wet ingredients with a hand mixer on medium speed for about 4 minutes so the sugar dissolves.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don't have a hand mixer, whisk the mixture by hand for 6 to 8 minutes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Beat 4 large eggs into the wet mixture, 1 at a time. Turn off the mixer and crack 1 egg into the bowl with the wet mixture. Beat the mixture for about 30 seconds before you turn off the beater and add another egg. Keep beating in the eggs 1 at a time and mixing for 30 seconds after each.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Mix in the dry ingredients and beat the batter for 5 minutes. Turn your hand mixer to low and slowly add the dry mixture to the wet ingredients. Once the dry ingredients are absorbed, turn the mixer to medium speed and beat the batter for 5 minutes.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Stop and scrape the sides of the bowl once or twice while you're mixing the batter.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Stir in 1 cup (93 g) of unsweetened shredded coconut. Put the toasted shredded coconut into the batter and stir just until the coconut is incorporated. Don't use the flaked coconut since you'll be using it to garnish the top of the bread.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Spread the batter in the pan and scatter coconut flakes on top. Pour the batter into your prepared loaf pan and scrape the sides of the bowl to get all of the batter in. Then, sprinkle 1/4 cup (23 g) of unsweetened coconut flakes over the top of the batter.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don't want the coconut bread to have coconut flakes on top, skip this step.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Bake the coconut bread for 80-95 minutes. Bake the bread for 80 minutes before you check it. To test if it's done, stick a toothpick into the center of the bread. The toothpick should come out clean if the bread's done.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 17 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the toothpick has batter on it, bake the bread for 5 minutes before you check it again.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remove the bread from the pan and cool it on a wire rack. Once your coconut bread is baked, wear oven mitts to take it out of the oven. Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, carefully flip it onto a wire rack and let it cool completely before you slice it.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-18-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 18 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-18-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Put the cooled bread into an airtight container and keep it at room temperature for up to 4 days.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Moist Coconut Bread with Sweet Glaze\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Moist-Coconut-Bread-with-Sweet-Glaze_2\">Moist Coconut Bread with Sweet Glaze</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Preheat the oven to and grease 2 loaf pans. Set 2 loaf pans on the counter and spray the insides with nonstick spray. If you don't want to use nonstick spray, spread a thin layer of butter or shortening inside each pan and coat them with flour. Then, shake out the excess flour and put the pan aside.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can use a pan, but you'll need to reduce the cooking time by 10 minutes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Mix the sugar, buttermilk, oil, eggs, and coconut extract in a bowl. Get out a big mixing bowl and pour in 2 cups (400 g) of sugar. Add of buttermilk, of vegetable oil, 4 lightly beaten eggs, and of coconut extract. Then, whisk until the eggs are incorporated.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don't have coconut extract, substitute the same amount of vanilla extract.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Whisk the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Place another large bowl on the counter and put 3 cups (360 g) of all-purpose flour into it. Add 2 teaspoons (10 g) of baking powder, 1⁄2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of baking soda, and 1 teaspoon (5 g) of salt to the bowl. Then, whisk for 30 seconds so the leaveners are really well mixed.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Check the expiration dates on your baking powder and baking soda. If you accidentally use expired leaveners, your coconut bread won't rise.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Stir the dry ingredients and coconut into the wet ingredients to make batter. Slowly mix the dry ingredients into the bowl with the wet mixture. Stop mixing just as soon as the dry ingredients are absorbed. Then, gently stir in 1 cup (92 g) of shredded coconut.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For a richer flavor, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Toast-Coconut\" title=\"Toast Coconut\">toast the shredded coconut</a> before you stir it into the batter.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Divide the batter between the pans. Spoon half of the batter into each greased loaf pan and use the back of the spoon to spread the batter so it's level. If you have a hard time eyeballing this, scoop the batter into the pans with a measuring cup so you can ensure that they're evenly filled.<br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 23 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-23-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Bake the bread for 50 to 60 minutes. Put the loaves in the oven and bake them until they're browned. To test if the bread's done, stick a toothpick into the center of one to see if only a few crumbs stick to it.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-24-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Coconut Bread Step 24 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-24-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-24-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the toothpick is coated with batter when you pull it out, bake the bread for another 5 minutes before you check it again.</li> \n    <li>To store the coconut bread, put it into an airtight container and keep it at room temperature for up to 5 days.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>For a fruity coconut bread that's popular in the Caribbean, add 1/4 cup (36 g) of raisins to the batter along with the coconut.<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>If your coconut bread looks like it's browning too much, lay a sheet of aluminum foil over the top so you can finish baking the bread.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Simple Coconut Quick Bread\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Simple-Coconut-Quick-Bread_3\">Simple Coconut Quick Bread</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Measuring cups and spoons</li> \n  <li>Mixing bowls</li> \n  <li>Whisk</li> \n  <li>Spatula</li> \n  <li>loaf pan</li> \n  <li>Toothpick or cake tester</li> \n  <li>Wire rack</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Gluten-Free Coconut Bread\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Gluten-Free-Coconut-Bread_3\">Gluten-Free Coconut Bread</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Measuring cups and spoons</li> \n  <li>Mixing bowl</li> \n  <li>Whisk</li> \n  <li>Spoon</li> \n  <li>Toothpick</li> \n  <li>loaf pan</li> \n  <li>Parchment paper</li> \n  <li>Wire rack</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Moist Coconut Bread\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Moist-Coconut-Bread\">Moist Coconut Bread</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Measuring cups and spoons</li> \n  <li>Mixing bowls</li> \n  <li>Whisk</li> \n  <li>Spatula</li> \n  <li>2 loaf pans</li> \n  <li>Toothpick or cake tester</li> \n  <li>Wire rack</li> \n  <li>Spoon or hand mixer</li> \n  <li>Piping bag, optional</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Coconut-Bread&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://smittenkitchen.com/2013/03/coconut-bread/\">https://smittenkitchen.com/2013/03/coconut-bread/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2002/01/09/dining/the-egg-master-of-sydney.html\">https://www.nytimes.com/2002/01/09/dining/the-egg-master-of-sydney.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://smittenkitchen.com/2013/03/coconut-bread/\">https://smittenkitchen.com/2013/03/coconut-bread/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2002/01/09/dining/the-egg-master-of-sydney.html\">https://www.nytimes.com/2002/01/09/dining/the-egg-master-of-sydney.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/wkWGfZ7SnE4?t=59\">https://youtu.be/wkWGfZ7SnE4?t=59</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Coconut-Bread#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/gluten-free-coconut-bread\">https://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/gluten-free-coconut-bread</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Dec 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"1a5c1ee2415506ed6ee2c7aca549d06d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-00-31-937_106f07053a6de851.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":72726,"destBytes":49460,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-00-31-937_106f07053a6de851.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn99@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-01-02-128_78af990f6e63389f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn27@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-00-54-476_e0b20e38617790a5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn10@2020_2/2020/12/11/08-00-59-272_3960a11d8131a6cd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn34@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-01-09-918_0a034bd0e4e19f5b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn14@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-01-00-980_f914a33a27ce64bd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-17-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn79@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-01-01-814_824390edf922b371.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-18-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn26@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-00-59-494_80dda7ec974b9383.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-23-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-23-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn95@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-00-54-469_63ffd6196beef775.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-24-Version-2.jpg/aid12172740-v4-728px-Make-Coconut-Bread-Step-24-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn42@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-01-01-373_16ff930488ebf451.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607673631413},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","title":"How to Ship a Package at the Post Office","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Whether you’re shipping a package to a client or a friend, the United States Postal Service can be a reliable and economical option for you. Shipping a package from the post office may seem like a complicated and confusing process, but it’s actually pretty easy if you know your shipping options and how to properly prepare your package for shipment. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Choosing a Shipping Method\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Choosing-a-Shipping-Method\">Choosing a Shipping Method</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Use Retail Ground for the most affordable shipping option. Formerly known as Standard Post, Retail Ground is the cheapest way to ship a package via the USPS. But it is also the slowest, with a delivery rate between 2-8 business days. If time is not a huge concern for your shipment, then Retail Ground is a great option.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Retail Ground can sometimes take up to 14 business days to deliver your package.</li> \n    <li>The maximum weight for sending packages via Retail Ground is .</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use Priority Mail to pay a flat rate regardless of the weight of the package. Priority Mail has an expected delivery time of 1-3 days and includes free tracking. This shipping option offers many “flat rate” boxes, which means if the package fits inside of the standard box offered by the USPS, then the weight doesn’t matter. This can take the hassle out of weighing the package and making sure you include enough postage.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can use Priority Mail to send packages weighing up to .</li> \n    <li>All of the boxes and envelopes for Priority Mail are free! You can request to have them shipped to your home or office, or you can pick up what you need from the post office. by .<br /><br /><b>Padded Flat Rate Envelope</b>: A waterproof, padded envelope that's by .<br /><br /><b>Small Flat Rate Box</b>: A small, cardboard box measuring x x .<br /><br /><b>Medium Flat Rate Boxes</b>: A box with the dimensions x x OR x x .<br /><br /><b>Large Flat Rate Box</b>: The largest flat rate box, which measures x x .}}</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use Express Mail for the fastest delivery time. The Priority Mail Express option is the most expensive shipping option, but it is also the fastest and has a money-back guarantee. It is the USPS version of next day delivery, taking 1-2 business days to arrive. It also offers flat rate boxes that allow you to ship anything that fits as long as the package weighs less than .<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Express Mail also has an expedited service to have your package delivered by 3 p.m. the next day.</li> \n    <li>Express Mail also provides insurance coverage for up to $100, a signature confirmation of delivery, and tracking information.</li> \n    <li>Note that Priority Mail Express often has a separate pick-up and drop-off time in order to arrive at its destination on time. Contact your post office by phone or go online to confirm the drop-off time.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use First-Class Mail to ship envelopes that weigh less than . The First-Class Mail shipping service is an affordable way to send a lightweight package quickly. Packages are delivered within 1-3 business days, and the USPS offers insurance for loss or damage up to $5,000 for merchandise. You can also add additional services like delivery confirmation, which allows you to track your package as it travels to its destination.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Use padded envelopes to send First-Class Mail for their light weight and durability.</li> \n    <li>To send a lightweight package via First-Class Mail, the envelope must not exceed by , or your package will be charged at the next higher price or mailing category.</li> \n    <li>Your package must be at least thick. If your package doesn’t fit the dimensions, the USPS may return it, or automatically upgrade the shipping and charge the customer.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Send books, CDs, and other media using Media Mail. The USPS Media Mail service is a cost-effective way to send media like sound and video recordings on a disk, manuscripts, sheet music, printed educational charts, medical binders, and computer-readable media safely across the country.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Video games and computer hard drives do not qualify for Media Mail prices.</li> \n    <li>Media Mail has a maximum weight of .</li> \n    <li>Ask a postal worker if your items qualify as Media Mail before you package it up and ship it from the post office.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Packaging and Sending Your Shipment\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Packaging-and-Sending-Your-Shipment\">Packaging and Sending Your Shipment</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Place your shipment into a box or envelope and seal it shut. Fit your item or items into the box or envelope, add cushioning materials (like bubble wrap, newspaper, or packing peanuts) if necessary, and seal the envelope or tape the box shut with packing tape so that it closes flat on all sides. Reinforce the flaps on the top and bottom with tape so that the box doesn’t open in transit.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-6.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For Retail Ground and First Class Mail, you can use any sturdy cardboard box. You don’t have to use the USPS Priority Mail box.</li> \n    <li>Use a box that will hold your shipment, but leaves a little bit of room for you to add any padding material.</li> \n    <li>If your box has other stickers or logos other than the USPS logo for Priority Mail boxes, you can cross them out with a marker or cover them with your postage label.</li> \n    <li>Make sure your box does not have anything loose hanging from it like twine, string, or tape because it can get caught in the sorting equipment.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-an-Address-on-a-Package\" title=\"Write an Address on a Package\">Address</a> the package clearly. You can use label stickers or write the address directly onto the package. Be sure to put a return address and include the zip codes. Use ink that doesn’t smear so the address remains legible as it travels to its destination.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Use a permanent marker if you’re writing the address directly on the package.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Bring your package to the post office to measure and weigh it. Before you can ship your package, you have to pay for the correct postage, which means you need accurate size and weight measurements. A postal worker at the retail counter of your post office will weigh and measure the package to determine how much postage it requires. They will also be able to inspect the package to confirm that it has been prepared correctly.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-8.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>When the postal worker calculates the necessary postage, be sure to ask about the cost for confirmation numbers as they may cost extra depending on your shipping method.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Apply the postage to the package. After your package has been weighed and measured, you can purchase the necessary postage to have it shipped. Apply the postage to the package in a clearly visible location. The postage label will include a barcode that will be scanned as it is processed during its journey to be delivered, so make sure the label is easy to find and scan.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7d/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A postal worker can also give the cost to ship for multiple methods so you can compare and choose the best option for your shipping needs.</li> \n    <li>The postal worker at the post office will often apply the postage to your package for you if you purchased it from them.</li> \n    <li>Postage always goes in the top-right corner of an envelope, but this can vary for packages.</li> \n    <li>If you printed your own postage on regular paper, use clear tape and cover the paper entirely so it doesn’t get too wet to read or scan.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Give your package to the postal worker at the retail desk. The postal worker behind the counter can confirm that the package has been properly prepared and the correct postage has been applied. They will then scan the package and process it for delivery. They can also provide you with a confirmation or receipt of the transaction.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-10.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Get a tracking number if desired. Tracking information allows you to follow the package in transit. This is a great feature if you need to check the status of a package or need to verify that it was delivered. It may cost extra for tracking information on a package being sent via First-Class Mail or Retail Ground, but it can give you peace of mind knowing the status of your shipment.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ship a Package at the Post Office Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-11.jpg/aid616825-v4-728px-Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Tracking information comes free with Priority Mail, Priority Express, and First-Class Mail.</li> \n    <li>You can also get a signature confirmation if you need to verify that the package was received by a person.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Save-a-Trip-to-the-Post-Office\" title=\"Save a Trip to the Post Office\">Save a Trip to the Post Office</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Mail-Packages-Faster\" title=\"Mail Packages Faster\">Mail Packages Faster</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-an-Address-on-an-Envelope\" title=\"Write an Address on an Envelope\">Write an Address on an Envelope</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ship-a-Package-at-the-Post-Office&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section:
