free\" href=\"http://www.pbs.org/parents/crafts-for-kids/marshmallow-dreidels/\">http://www.pbs.org/parents/crafts-for-kids/marshmallow-dreidels/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.craftsy.com/blog/2013/04/how-to-melt-candy-melts/\">https://www.craftsy.com/blog/2013/04/how-to-melt-candy-melts/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.pbs.org/parents/crafts-for-kids/marshmallow-dreidels/\">http://www.pbs.org/parents/crafts-for-kids/marshmallow-dreidels/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.pbs.org/parents/crafts-for-kids/marshmallow-dreidels/\">http://www.pbs.org/parents/crafts-for-kids/marshmallow-dreidels/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.pbs.org/parents/crafts-for-kids/marshmallow-dreidels/\">http://www.pbs.org/parents/crafts-for-kids/marshmallow-dreidels/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Dec 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-1.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"d55313019e17a128167a5497b0cbe43c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn71@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-00-31-745_cd1bcbc8625b343e.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":485,"sourceBytes":57032,"destBytes":34698,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-1.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn71@2020_4/2020/12/11/08-00-31-745_cd1bcbc8625b343e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-2.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn62@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-01-00-265_3396efba36221398.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-3.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn81@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-00-57-399_863cae65d290aefe.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7d/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-4.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn89@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-01-07-949_4057064eac7d742e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-5.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn9@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-00-55-404_66fe4d803c3936fe.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-6.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn1@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-01-00-879_20f666eb60e30828.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-7.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn65@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-01-02-984_3805ad7570ecdcc6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-8.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn22@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-00-59-383_fe1370d45e6b25f5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-9.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn55@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-01-09-496_24e08cea0708ce81.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-10.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn90@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-00-54-994_2fa282376c8e9248.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-11.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn81@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-00-58-739_5c081dab976f8e3e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-12.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn97@2020_6/2020/12/11/08-00-59-187_5a49a7a38d51734f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-13.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn6@2020_5/2020/12/11/08-01-07-996_47476824e9577d49.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-14.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn43@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-01-09-329_162eab20d37866a1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-15.jpg/aid8358388-v4-728px-Make-Dreidel-Marshmallow-Pops-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn31@2020_3/2020/12/11/08-01-03-856_c43e5ef5e9538604.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607673631404},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","title":"How to Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Any late payments listed on your credit report will lower your credit score, which can make it harder for you to get a loan, mortgage, insurance, and even a job. Luckily, there are steps you can take to remove the late payment from your history and repair your credit. First, check your records to find out if the charge is a mistake or legitimate. If you really did miss a payment, then you can appeal to your creditors to remove the payment. If you discover that you paid the bill, then you can dispute the charge with the credit agencies. In either case, you'll be on your way to fixing your credit report soon. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Investigation and Evidence\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Investigation-and-Evidence\">Investigation and Evidence</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Get a copy of your credit report by contacting the 3 reporting agencies. If your credit score drops or you suspect that a late payment is being recorded on your score, then start by obtaining your full credit report. Request a report from all three credit reporting agencies: TransUnion, Equifax, and Experian. You can do this by calling 1-877-322-8228, or by visiting their website at annualcreditreport.com. You will need to provide your name, Social Security number, address, and date of birth.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You are allowed a free copy of your credit report every 12 months. You are also allowed a copy if you've been denied a loan or credit, are unemployed and looking for a job, or were the victim of fraud or identity theft.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Identify the late payments on each credit report. Once you get your reports, go through each one very carefully. Check for any errors or potential problems that might be hurting your credit score. If you find any, write down the date, charge amount, and creditor to start your appeal process. Some things to look out for include:<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Payments marked late that you know you paid, bills listed twice, bills more than 7 years old, open credit lines or accounts that you think you closed, and inaccurate credit limits.</li> \n    <li>The 3 credit reports might not be exactly the same. It's normal for some agencies to report more than others.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Check your bank statements for evidence if you paid the bill. If there is a late payment marked on your credit report, then check your bank records to see if you paid it. Your statement should show a date that you made the payment. If you can find the payment on your statement, then you have a good case to dispute the charge with the credit agency.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It's easy to check your bank statements with online banking. If you don't have online access, call your bank to get a full account and payment history.</li> \n    <li>It's also possible that you'll find out you really did miss a payment. In this case, submitting a goodwill letter to your creditor is a good option to try and get that removed.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Report fraud or identity theft to the bank and FTC to eliminate the charge. It's unfortunately always a possibility that late payments are because of fraud. If you can't verify payments on your report, then you may have been the victim of identity theft.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup> Report the fraud to the credit agency, your bank, and the Federal Trade Commission right away to prevent further damage to your credit. If this was indeed a fraudulent charge, then it'll be removed from your credit record.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you know who stole your identity, you can also report the fraud to the police.</li> \n    <li>Some fraud red flags to look out for include addresses or names on your credit report that you don't recognize, accounts that you don't own, payments to companies you don't recognize, or payments that you can't verify.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Goodwill Letters for Creditors\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Goodwill-Letters-for-Creditors\">Goodwill Letters for Creditors</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Thank the creditor and detail the reason for the letter. If you have a good history with your creditor, then they might be willing to work with you and get rid of the charge. Start by thanking your creditor for their service and stating that you've been a good customer for some time. Additionally, make sure to state that your letter is a goodwill letter and not a dispute letter so they understand what's going on.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, “To whom it may concern, I have been a loyal customer for over five years, and I would like to first thank you for your services throughout the years. I am writing to ask that a goodwill adjustment be made to my account. This is not a dispute of accuracy of credit reporting.”</li> \n    <li>You can also write an email instead of a letter if you have the creditor's contact information. Follow the same steps for a goodwill letter.</li> \n    <li>If you don't have a good history with the creditor, then a goodwill letter will probably not work. In this case, you'll have to call and negotiate a removal.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Explain the reasons for the late payment. Acknowledge that the late payment is your fault, but that certain circumstances prevented you from paying on time. Explain what happened so the company can sympathize with you. Avoid using the excuse, “I forgot.”<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, “During the time that the late payment occurred, I became hospitalized due to an illness. Unfortunately, this caused me to lose my job and I wasn’t able to make my payments on time.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Include the reason that you want the late payment removed. If you need to improve your credit score to qualify for a car or mortgage loan, include this in the letter. If you have an existing loan with a high interest rate, then wanting to refinance your loan is also a legitimate reason for wanting to improve your credit score.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, “I am about to begin the process of purchasing a new car. When reviewing my loan options, the loan officer notified me that the late payment was preventing me from taking advantage of low interest rates.\"</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remind the creditor that you were making consistent payments. Pointing out that you were making consistent payments before the late payment occurred may help sway the creditor's opinion in your favor. Additionally, if you have been making consistent payments since the late payment occurred, point this out too.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, \"Once I overcame my illness, I was able to find a new job. I have been making consistent payments since then. I would also like to note that I had been making consistent payments before my illness. Since I have a pretty consistent record, I am asking that you please give me a second chance, and remove the late payment from my account.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Conclude the letter by thanking them for their time again. Maintain a friendly tone, even if you think there was some kind of error. Also offer to answer any questions that they might have, or provide any supporting documents that may help them decide.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, “Thank you for your time and consideration. I really appreciate it. Please feel free to contact me for any additional documentation that would assist you in reaching a positive outcome.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Send the letter to the company’s customer service address. Whether your creditor is a bank or private lender, send the letter to the recommended customer service address. This way, you'll know that your request will end up in the right hands.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure to request a “return receipt request” service. This way you can keep track of what the creditor received for your records.</li> \n    <li>You can also send this as an email to the lender's email address.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Follow-up if you don't hear back within a few weeks. Persistence might help your case. If a few weeks go by and you haven't heard anything from the lender, try calling or emailing to see if they received your letter. This might remind them to have a look at your case.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Be prepared to plead your case again when you contact the lender. Remind them that you've been a great customer and made an honest mistake during a hard time. This might sway them.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Phone Negotiation\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Phone-Negotiation\">Phone Negotiation</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Contact your creditor’s customer service. Visit the website of the creditor you are in debt to. Call the customer service number provided. Explain to the representative that you would like to talk to someone about a late payment on your account. They will either transfer your call, or give you the account manager’s information.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A customer service number is typically located at the bottom of the webpage.</li> \n    <li>The first person you talk to is probably just a customer service rep who won't be able to make any change to your credit history. You'll have to specifically ask for a manager or someone with the authority to make the change.</li> \n    <li>It's very important to stay polite and courteous with everyone you speak to. Representatives are much more willing to work with polite people instead of rude people. It's definitely understandable to feel stressed, but don't take it out on the people you're speaking with.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tell the creditor about any hardships that caused your late payments. Emergencies happen, and some creditors are willing to work with you in these cases. Be sure to mention any problems you encountered, like an illness, natural disaster, job loss, or other financial hardship. The creditor might be more willing to make an exception for you and remove the late payment.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some creditors have hardship plans for people who have experienced these problems. You can negotiate a lower rate or lump sum payment to satisfy your debt with these plans.</li> \n    <li>In the future, it's always best to contact your creditor right away if you experience a hardship. This way, they can work with you right off the bat instead of waiting until you've fallen behind.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Sign up for automatic payments. Many creditors will agree to remove a late payment if you sign up for automatic payments in exchange for the removal. Let the creditor know that you have the funds, like a stable job, to qualify for automatic payments.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This method works well if you only have 1 or 2 late payments on your account.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Offer to pay off the balance. Tell the creditor that you are willing to pay off all or part of the debt in exchange for deletion of the late payments. If the creditor agrees, make sure to request the agreement in writing.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you have a payment that is more than 120 days late, then this method may not work.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>State that you'll close your account if the creditor can't work with you. Ultimately, creditors want your business, so the risk of losing a customer might make them more willing to work with you. As a last resort, you could always threaten to cancel your account with this creditor and find another one. This could give them a push to make some exceptions to keep you as a customer.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-16.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Continue to be friendly and courteous if you take this route. Say something like, \"Unfortunately, if you can't do anything to help me, I'll have to find another creditor to work with.\" Stay calm and don't yell.</li> \n    <li>Note that this might only work if you were a good customer. If you have a poor credit history with this creditor, they might not be sad to see you leave.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Online Disputes for Inaccurate Charges\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Online-Disputes-for-Inaccurate-Charges\">Online Disputes for Inaccurate Charges</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Go to the dispute page for each of the major credit agencies. The 3 major credit reporting agencies, Equifax, TransUnion, and Experian, all have dispute tabs on their websites. If you have evidence that the late payment is a mistake or fraudulent, then go to these pages and file a dispute with each of the reporting agencies to have it removed.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-17.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Equifax: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.equifax.com/personal/credit-report-services/credit-dispute/#\">https://www.equifax.com/personal/credit-report-services/credit-dispute/#</a></li> \n    <li>Transunion: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.transunion.com/credit-disputes/dispute-your-credit\">https://www.transunion.com/credit-disputes/dispute-your-credit</a></li> \n    <li>Experian: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.transunion.com/credit-disputes/dispute-your-credit\">https://www.transunion.com/credit-disputes/dispute-your-credit</a></li> \n    <li>Note that this option is only appropriate if you believe the late fee is a mistake or fraud. If there actually is a late payment on your record, you have to contact the lender instead of the reporting agencies.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Create an account with the reporting agency if you don’t have one. In order to submit a dispute, you have to make an account with each reporting agency. Click the option to make an account and fill in the required information like your name and contact information. Make a password and then your account is complete.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-18.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 18.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-18.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-18.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you already have an account, you can just sign in normally.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Select the charge that you want to dispute. Once you’re in your account, select the option to open a dispute. A list of the late payments on your record should pop up. Select the charge that you want to dispute.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-19.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 19.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-19.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-19.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you want to dispute multiple late payments, then you’ll probably have to select each one separately.</li> \n    <li>The particular process for selecting and submitting disputes might be different for each agency. Follow the directions for each one and contact customer service if you have any problems.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Explain the reason for the dispute. When you make your selections, you’ll probably be asked to provide details about the dispute. Explain why you think the charge is a mistake and should be removed. Mention relevant evidence you have, like proof that you paid the bill or identity theft.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-20.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 20.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-20.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-20.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There might also be a dropdown menu to further categorize your dispute. Select the option that matches your dispute the closest.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Upload any evidence you have proving the error. Some reporting agencies give you a section to upload supporting documents. This helps you prove your case, so scan in any evidence you have and upload it with your dispute.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-21.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 21.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-21.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-21.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Relevant documents are bank statements showing that you paid the bill, letters from your creditor saying that the bill was paid, or any other documents that prove the payment should be removed.</li> \n    <li>Circle parts of the documents that prove your claim. For example, the date of a payment is relevant to your case.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Submit the dispute and let the agency process it. Once you’ve filled everything out, review it all carefully. When you’re satisfied that you’ve provided as much information as you can, hit “Submit.” Now it’s up to the agencies to process your dispute and respond.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-22.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 22.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e7/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-22.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-22.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Wait about 30 days for the agencies to respond. In most cases, the credit agencies will take about 2-4 weeks to process and review your claim. During that time, they’ll reach out to the lenders and see if the late payment is accurate or not. If they find out the report was a mistake, they will correct it. When they’re done, they’ll respond to you with the verdict.<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-23.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 23.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-23.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-23.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>By law, the agencies have to send a notice of credit correction to anyone that you ask them to. If you were trying to get a loan or rent an apartment, for example, you can ask them to send a report to the lender and landlord to prove that the charge was a mistake.</li> \n    <li>If the agency finds that the charge was legitimate but you still don’t agree, you can request that a dispute notice be added to your report. That way, people who view the report will see that you’re in the process of challenging the charge.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Complain to the CFPB if the agencies aren’t cooperating. If for any reason you feel that the credit agencies aren’t handling your request or siding with you despite your evidence, can you officially complain to the US government’s Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. They can review the dispute and see if you’re being treated unfairly. If they agree with your claim, then they can order the agencies to remove the charge.<sup id=\"_ref-24\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-24\">[24]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-24.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 24.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-24.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-24.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To submit a CFPB complaint, visit <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.consumerfinance.gov/complaint/\">https://www.consumerfinance.gov/complaint/</a> and fill out the necessary information.</li> \n    <li>In most cases, the CFPB can get back to you within 15 days.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Mail-In Disputes\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Mail-In-Disputes\">Mail-In Disputes</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Write a dispute letter for late payments you think are a mistake. At the top of the letter, write your complete name and current address. Write a letter that is simple and to the point. Identify each disputed item on the report and the reasons for why you are disputing the information. Then request that the disputed item be removed or corrected. Before sending the letter, make a copy of it for your records.<sup id=\"_ref-25\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 25\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-25\">[25]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-25.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 25.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-25.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-25.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, “To whom it may concern, I am writing you to dispute the information on my report. The late Amazon payment is an error because I paid it on time. I am asking that the item be deleted from my account. Enclosed is my report with the disputed items circled, as well as my bank statement supporting my position. Please review the information and correct the error as soon as possible.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Include copies of supporting materials to prove your case. Include a copy of your credit report with the disputed item circled in red. Include copies of payment records from your bank, court documents, and any other materials that support your case.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-26.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 26.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-26.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-26.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure to include copies of the original documents instead of the original ones.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Send the letter and documents through certified mail. Send your letter and supporting documents to each reporting agency. Make sure to request a “return receipt requested” service. This way you can keep track of what the credit reporting agency received. The following are the addresses for each agency:<sup id=\"_ref-26\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 26\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-26\">[26]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-27.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 27.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-27.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-27.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Experian, P.O. Box 2002, Allen, TX 75013</li> \n    <li>TransUnion, Baldwin Place, P.O. Box 2000, Chester, PA 19022</li> \n    <li>Equifax Information Services, LLC, P.O. Box 740256, Atlanta, GA 30374</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wait about 30 days for a response. Credit reporting agencies must investigate your case within 30 days. If verification shows that the error on your report was valid, then they must remove it and update your information. The agency will send you a letter in writing with the results, and free copy of an updated report if changes were made to it.<sup id=\"_ref-27\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 27\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-27\">[27]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-28.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Late Payments from Your Credit Report Step 28.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-28.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-28.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the agency cannot verify the information’s accuracy on your report, then they will remove it.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Whenever you get an agreement from a creditor or a reporting agency, get it in writing. You might need this if the dispute isn't resolved.</li> \n  <li>Creditors or credit agencies are more likely to side with your if you stay on top of your payments normally. They're much more willing to see the late payment as an honest mistake in this case. This is a good reason to keep your credit in as good of shape as possible.</li> \n  <li>If you need help, you can always hire a credit adviser to negotiate with the creditors for you. These are professionals who know the right things to say, so they might be more successful than you if you aren't sure what to do.<sup id=\"_ref-28\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 28\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_note-28\">[28]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span it-Report-Step-27.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-27.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn53@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-00-54-768_b089fa37e015aeb8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-28.jpg/aid9365339-v4-728px-Remove-Late-Payments-from-Your-Credit-Report-Step-28.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn46@2020_1/2020/12/11/08-01-05-611_462ead4d0bb4291d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1607673631429},{"createdTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","updatedTime":"2020-12-11 16:00:31","title":"How to Make Gummy Bears","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Gummy bears are some of the simplest candies to make at home. At their core, they are just 4 ingredients: water, sugar, gelatin, and flavoring. Water and gelatin, when blended, heated, and cooled, naturally form a chewy candy, so you don’t need any expensive equipment or odd ingredients to create homemade gummy bears. To get bear shapes, you will need gummy bear molds. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Ingredients\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Ingredients\">Ingredients</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Quick and Easy Gummies\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-and-Easy-Gummies\">Quick and Easy Gummies</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>of cold water</li> \n  <li>2 tbsp (20 g) of unflavored gelatin</li> \n  <li>1 packet (85 g) of flavored gelatin</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Classic Gummy Bears\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Classic-Gummy-Bears\">Classic Gummy Bears</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>of gelatin, 250 bloom</li> \n  <li>of water</li> \n  <li>of sugar</li> \n  <li>of sorbitol powder</li> \n  <li>of glucose syrup, or</li> \n  <li>of tartaric or citric acid</li> \n  <li>of food grade essential oil, any flavor</li>\n </ul> \n <p><i>Prep time: 20-25 minutes (active prep: 5-10 minutes)</i><br /><br /> <i>Cook time: 10-15 minutes</i><br /><br /> <i>Total time: 30-40 minutes</i> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Quick and Easy Gummies\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-and-Easy-Gummies_2\">Quick and Easy Gummies</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Place of cold water in a small saucepan on the stove. Don't start the stove yet. It is easiest to mix the ingredients right in the pan since the gummy mixture will stick slightly if you try and transfer it from another container.<br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-1-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Gummy Bears Step 1 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-1-Version-6.jpg/aid169186-v4-728px-Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-1-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Add 2 tbsp (20 g) of unflavored gelatin to the water. You can find this at most grocery stores in the baking aisle.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For a vegan substitute, try agar agar powder, which you can buy online or from a health food store. You can substitute agar agar for gelatin in the same amounts, so there’s no need to adjust your measurements for this recipe.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add 1 packet (85 g) of flavored gelatin and mix well. The most common brand is Jell-O. The flavor you use will determine the color and flavor of the final gummies.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Flavored gelatin comes in many flavors and colors, so you can make a whole rainbow of gummy bears. For example, you could get strawberry, orange, lime, and blue raspberry.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Heat up the mixture on medium-low heat for 10-15 minutes. Just keep stirring occasionally so that all the gelatin is completely dissolved in the water. Go slowly so that none of the candy burns.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Turn the heat off and pour the mixture into a mixing cup. Any cup that is easily poured is fine. You can also use an eyedropper or a candy pump for more intricate designs.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-5-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Gummy Bears Step 5 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-5-Version-6.jpg/aid169186-v4-728px-Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-5-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Pour the mixture into your molds and put them in the freezer for 15-20 minutes. Simply pour the warm gelatin mixture into your candy mold and freeze it until it is set. The gummy bears are now ready to eat.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don't have a mold, you can make gummy drops on some parchment paper instead.</li> \n    <li>You can leave the gummies in the freezer longer, if you like. Frozen gummy bears are chewier and taste juicier than refrigerated or room-temperature gummies.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> If you put them in an airtight container, they’ll keep for up to a year in the freezer before their quality starts to decline.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Classic Gummy Bears\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Classic-Gummy-Bears_2\">Classic Gummy Bears</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pre-measure your ingredients to make classic “Gold Bears.<b>”</b> To get perfect, store-bought texture and taste in your gummies, you'll need a few harder-to-find ingredients as well as high-end gelatin (known as 250 bloom). Measure your ingredients by weight instead of by volume for more accurate results. Weigh them out in advance and have them on hand to be quickly mixed in—timing in candy making is key. To make this classic gummy bear recipe, you’ll need:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-7-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Gummy Bears Step 7 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-7-Version-5.jpg/aid169186-v4-728px-Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-7-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>of gelatin, 250 bloom</li> \n    <li>of water</li> \n    <li>of sugar</li> \n    <li>of sorbitol powder</li> \n    <li>of glucose syrup, or</li> \n    <li>of tartaric or citric acid</li> \n    <li>of food grade essential oil, any flavor</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Mix your gelatin and water. You can mix them together with a whisk or, like classic candy makers, in a water bath. If you’re mixing with a whisk, combine the water and gelatin directly in the saucepan over low heat until the gelatin dissolves.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To do a water bath, warm a large bowl of water up so that it is hot, but not boiling. Mix the of gelatin and of water in a Ziplock bag and let it rest in the water bath for 30 minutes.</li> \n    <li>The bag should be free of lumps or streaks when it is fully mixed.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Blend your sugar, sorbitol, and glucose syrup on the stove at medium heat. Stir the ingredients well so that they're properly mixed up, but not boiling or bubbling. If you have a candy thermometer, get them to .<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Mix in your gelatin mixture slowly. With the heat still on, mix in the gelatin and water mixture from earlier. Stir until it is all completely mixed, then turn the heat off and move quickly to the next step.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Add in your desired flavorings. You can flavor your gelatin with juice, flavoring acids (such as citric or tartaric acid), or flavored oils or extracts. You can also add 1/3 cup (about 77 g) of well-pureed fruit, like strawberries.<br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-11-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Gummy Bears Step 11 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-11-Version-4.jpg/aid169186-v4-728px-Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-11-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, lime, lemon, or orange juice are all good choices if you want to add a burst of citrus flavor.</li> \n    <li>For a more unusual flavor, try a flavoring oil or extract, such as vanilla extract, orange rind oil, or cherry extract.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup> If you use an essential oil, make sure it’s labeled as “edible” or “food grade,” since some essential oils are harmful to eat.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>This is also the time to add any food coloring.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Pour the mixture into your mold. You can use a light coating of cornstarch to prevent the final gummies from sticking, but many gummy-making pans are already non-stick. Simply pour the mixture into the mold then freeze it for 4-5 hours, or until the gummies are firm and completely set.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Flavoring without Packets\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Flavoring-without-Packets\">Flavoring without Packets</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Sprinkle your gummies lightly with citric acid to get a sour coating. Citric acid is a preservative, and it is not great for your teeth, so go lightly. A small amount is enough for a nice sour kick.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-13-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Gummy Bears Step 13 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-13-Version-4.jpg/aid169186-v4-728px-Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-13-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Use lemon and honey for citrus gummy bears. To make citrus gummy bears, you simply need to use some orange and lemon juice instead of a processed Jell-O packet. Honey also makes a healthier alternative to the corn syrup used in many store-bought gummies. To do this, mix the following ingredients in the saucepan, turn on the heat, then add 3 tablespoons (28 g) of gelatin. Continue like normal after the gelatin is added:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-14-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Gummy Bears Step 14 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-14-Version-4.jpg/aid169186-v4-728px-Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-14-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>of orange juice</li> \n    <li>of lemon juice</li> \n    <li>of honey</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try pureed strawberries or berries in your gummies. This incredible, fruity gummy is a big hit. Make sure the berries are thawed before adding them. Simply mix the following ingredients, then add 3 tbsp (28 g) of gelatin slowly as you heat up the mixture like normal.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-15-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Gummy Bears Step 15 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-15-Version-4.jpg/aid169186-v4-728px-Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-15-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>⅔ cup (174 g) of pureed strawberries/blueberries/raspberries</li> \n    <li>of water</li> \n    <li>of fresh lemon juice</li> \n    <li>of honey<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Replace the water with milk for a creamier texture. If you don’t eat dairy, even almond, soy, rice, coconut, or oat milk works well and imparts a distinct, creamy texture and feel to the common gummy. To make creamy gummies, whisk half the milk in with the gelatin. Then heat it up like normal, whisking in the other half right at the end before it comes off the heat.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-16-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Gummy Bears Step 16 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-16-Version-4.jpg/aid169186-v4-728px-Make-Gummy-Bears-Step-16-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Adding a touch of vanilla or almond extract, or even some cinnamon, to the mixture can take it to new heights.</li> \n    <li>This substitute works with basic gummies as well as the pureed fruit versions.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>The candy might stick to flimsy plastic molds, so try to get sturdy ones.</li> \n  <li>A very light coating of non-stick cooking spray can be used to line the plastic mold to make it easier for the candy to release when it is ready. Some recipes use cornstarch as well.</li> \n  <li>You can use 1 tsp (about 2-3 g) of Kool-Aid instead of flavored Jell-O.</li> \n  <li>Try using fruit purée mixed with water to thin it down. It will thicken up and give you an awesome burst of fruity flavor.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Not all gelatin is vegan, kosher, or halal. Check the ingredients carefully before purchasing if you have any special dietary needs.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Quick and Easy Gummies\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-and-Easy-Gummies_3\">Quick and Easy Gummies</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Small saucepan</li> \n  <li>Measuring cups and spoons</li> \n  <li>Whisk</li> \n  <li>Gummy bear molds</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Classic Gummy Bears\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Classic-Gummy-Bears_3\">Classic Gummy Bears</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Kitchen scale</li> \n  <li>Small saucepan</li> \n  <li>Ziplock bag (for water bath)</li> \n  <li>Whisk</li> \n  <li>Gummy bear molds</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Vodka-Gummy-Bears\" title=\"Make Vodka Gummy Bears\">Make Vodka Gummy Bears</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Candy-Sushi\" \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Gummy-Bears&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.thekitchn.com/vegetarian-and-vegan-substitutes-for-gelatin-tips-from-the-kitchn-189478\">https://www.thekitchn.com/vegetarian-and-vegan-substitutes-for-gelatin-tips-from-the-kitchn-189478</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Gummy-Bears#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\"
